physical_examinations.vital_signs: Height: 116 cm, Weight: 40.5 kg, BMI: 30.1 kg/mÂ², Serum creatinine: 0.84 mg/dL, PTH: 458 pg/mL, Calcium: 7.9 mg/dL, Phosphorus: 9.2 mg/dL, TSH: 4.40 mIU/mL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild chronic kidney failure, high PTH levels, hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, bilateral valgus of the knees, shortening of the fourth and/or fifth metacarpal bones, multiple subcutaneous ossifications, severe sleep apnea requiring mechanical ventilation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Kidney function slowly deteriorated, leading to dialysis started at age 14 years. After renal transplantation at age 16 years, calcium and phosphate levels normalized and PTH values rapidly decreased.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Calcium: 7.6 mg/dL, Plasma phosphorus: 7 mg/dL, Plasma creatinine: 77 mmol/L, PTH: 997 pg/mL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild hypothyroidism (TSH: 5.66 mU/mL), free T4 at the lower limit of normal, absence of anti-thyroid antibodies.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: PTH: 23 pg/mL, Normal serum calcium and phosphate levels.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improved renal function and normalization of calcium, phosphate, and PTH levels after kidney transplantation.
